subject: Communication
title: Cognitive Empathy: Thinking What They Think
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Cognitive Empathy: Thinking What They Think.

hook.text: A hostage negotiator doesn't feel the kidnapper's emotions. He models them.

buildup.text: Cognitive empathy is the ability to understand someone's perspective and mental state without necessarily sharing.

discovery.text: It activates the brain's 'mentalizing network' ‚Äî the same regions used for theory of mind and perspective-taking.

twist.text: Cognitive empathy without emotional empathy can be dangerous.

climax.text: In professional settings, cognitive empathy is essential: understanding clients, users, and colleagues without.

punchline.text: Sometimes the best empathy isn't feeling with someone. It's thinking like them.

quiz.question: How does cognitive empathy differ from emotional empathy?
options: Cognitive empathy understands feelings without sharing them
